result.execSummary:
The defendant Doniel M. Escalera Fanello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to all other sentences.  In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant to pay court costs, DNA surcharge and Domestic Abuse Surcharge.
Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.  Defendant to submit DNA sample.
AODA Assessment and all follow through.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay court costs, domestic abuse surcharge, and DNA surcharge.  Unpaid costs to be converted to civil judgment.
To be served concurrent to 16CM146.  Court grants furlough on 1-5-2018 from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm.  Defendant eligible for huber for treatment.
